profile.name: Nacho
profile.title: .NET Developer
profile.description: Developer in beta phase. Excited to learn from my colleagues and superiors, trying to be as proactive as I can from my position, and eager to continue developing myself as a professional in this sector. With experience in international projects, handling C#, .NET Core, SQL Server, and Azure, and a positive attitude towards challenges, I enjoy working in multicultural teams and applying agile methodologies. Currently, I am involved in the modernization of applications using advanced architectures to achieve efficient and scalable solutions.

location.notes: Autocompleted using Google Maps API (id: ChIJkWK-FBFsEg0RSFb-HGIY8DQ)

challenges.description: Currently, I am involved in multiple projects developed with various versions of .NET and managed in Azure DevOps. Mainly, I am in a project consisting of the modernization of an application that originally ran on ASP.NET Web Forms and was divided into several projects, making it quite chaotic. The project is a development from scratch using Onion Architecture, following the MVC pattern with .NET 8 and Razor Pages.

Backend on an international project with Deloitte Germany as a developer for Mercedes Benz. The project initially consisted of creating a web application designed to optimize and automate stock vehicle configurations, using statistical methods to generate configuration recommendations that aligned with the real needs of customers based on economic, demographic, or situational indicators. Subsequently, we worked on migrating this application to make it more scalable and sustainable, adapting it to a microservices structure.

**Responsibilities:**

- Development and maintenance of APIs for efficient communication between different system components.
- Unit testing and some integration testing.
- Contributing to bug fixing and functional improvements.
- Refactoring to improve code quality and facilitate long-term maintenance.

**Solution Structure**
We used the hexagonal design pattern, separating and structuring solutions into different layers such as Api, Domain, or Infrastructure.

**Technologies and tools used:**

- **Development Environment**: Visual Studio 2022.
- **Programming Languages:** Mainly C# and SQL Server.
- **Framework:** .NET 6.0 and sometimes .NET 4.7.2 or .NET 8.
- **Testing:** Xunit or Junit.
- **Data Persistence:** Entity Framework along with LINQ, specifically in Database First.
- **Version Control:** We used Git for version control, managed through Azure DevOps.
- **Dependency and Package Management:** NuGet for efficient package management, incorporating external libraries and leveraging dependency injection principle.
- **Azure Services used:**
    - **Azure DevOps:** For comprehensive project management.
    - **Azure Virtual Machines:** Occasionally working in Azure virtual machine environments for certain tasks.
    - **Storage Account:** For data and file storage.
    - **Azure Key Vault:** For secure management of secrets and keys.
    - **Blob Service:** For specific needs of unstructured data.
    - **Azure Queue Storage:** To execute workers based on queue messages.
    - **Azure WebJobs:** To run workers that managed data ingestion or different processes.

**Work Methodology:** Agile, conducting Sprints every 3 weeks and also implementing continuous integration and deployment.

Production, writing, recording, and editing of a podcast for the «Cuonda» platform in which I review daily what is happening in the video game industry through short and dynamic episodes. I synthesize all the information published daily about this sector so that the listener can stay informed in less than 10 minutes.

- Preparation of the Cash Flow Budget and Income and Expenditure Budget for the year 2021.
- Bank reconciliation.
- Issuance and control of invoices.
- Control and management of the accounting archive.
- Accounting and management of remittances.
- Management of supplier payments.
My tasks were divided between operation, management, and maintenance of web applications and servers; incident resolution and phone support.
These internships were complementary to the training of Higher Technician in Web Application Development, for a total of 370 hours.

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription: My dream job currently is one that allows me to grow as a developer above all else. I am at a point where I need to prioritize interesting projects that provide me with experience and knowledge, and where best practices are genuinely taken into account. I also highly value a healthy work environment that fosters collective learning and teamwork.
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices:
I was very fortunate with the project where I made my debut as a developer. It allowed me to familiarize myself and follow good practices such as:

+ Layered Architecture
+ Development and maintenance of APIs documenting them
+ Unit and integration testing
+ Good version control practices with Git
+ Agile methodologies and CI/CD

On the other hand, I always try to write code in the cleanest way possible and according to the SOLID principles that I know, and I try, whenever I can, to refactor both my code and that of less experienced colleagues to make the solutions more robust and sustainable.

Regardless of this, I always try to keep learning and training myself as I can in relation to good development practices. I have already completed several courses on this subject and the latest has been the famous - and excellent - "Clean Code" by Uncle Bob, which I have been trying to put into practice in my day-to-day since I started the first page.
